channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: China says German naval ships in Taiwan Strait 'increase security risks'
item.description: China on Saturday accused Berlin of heightening security risks in the Taiwan Strait, a day after two German vessels sailed through the sensitive waters. "The German side's behaviour increases security risks and sends incorrect signals," Chinese military spokesperson Li Xi said in a statement.

item.title: ‘Modern bird wings first appeared in the archaeopteryx 145 million years ago — they haven’t changed much’
item.description: Palaeontologist Nick Longrich investigates the evolution of flight in dinosaurs, focusing on rare events that led to avian flight. His research on the archaeopteryx provides new insights into early bird wings and their development over millions of years, revealing how some adaptations have remained unchanged for 100 million years.

item.title: ‘The wings of huge pterosaurs and tiny bees differ — but they both produce thrust and lift’
Kamala Harris reveals she's a gun owner during debate with Donald Trump: What does it mean?
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris revealed she owns a handgun for personal safety during a debate, aiming to counter Republican claims about Democrats wanting to confiscate firearms. Harris seeks to bridge the gap between advocating for stricter gun regulations and addressing the concerns of gun owners, navigating the complex landscape of American gun politics.

item.title: Donald Trump on another debate with Kamala Harris: 'Maybe, if I got in the right mood ... '
item.description: Donald Trump hinted at reconsidering a second debate with Kamala Harris if he's in the right mood, emphasising his lead in polls and criticising the Biden-Harris administration. He dismissed a third debate, urging Harris to focus on her responsibilities over the past four years. Both are official presidential nominees for their parties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Michaela DePrince? Ballet icon who overcame civil war and orphanhood dies at 29
item.description: Michaela DePrince, a distinguished ballerina who triumphed over severe childhood adversities in Sierra Leone to achieve prominence as a second-soloist with the Boston Ballet, has died at 29. Besides her ballet career, she advocated for children impacted by war and appeared in notable documentaries and music videos.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Life's too short': US man purchases $395,000 cliffside home despite warnings that it might erode into the ocean
item.description: David Moot, an American interior painter and designer, acquired a cliffside home on Cape Cod for $395,000 despite warnings about coastal erosion. The three-bedroom house sits only 7.6 metres from a deteriorating cliff. This purchase exemplifies a growing trend of buying scenic properties at significant discounts amid climate change concerns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Lessons learned': Stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore on Boeing's return to earth
item.description: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore shared their relief after the Boeing Starliner spacecraft safely landed in New Mexico. During a live press conference from the ISS, they discussed their extended mission, lessons learned, and upcoming handover to Expedition 72 astronauts Nick and Alex. The astronauts are scheduled to return to Earth aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon in February.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Elijah Vue? Skeletal remains of missing 3-year-old found in Wisconsin
item.description: Elijah Vue, a three-year-old boy from Wisconsin Dells, vanished in February while under the care of his mother's boyfriend, Jesse Vang. His skeletal remains were found in September near Two Rivers. The community is devastated by the loss. Both his mother and Vang face child neglect charges but have pleaded not guilty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Purr-fect banger! Trump's 'they're eating the cats' has now turned into a viral song, watch
item.description: The South African band Kiffness created a parody song called "Eating the Cats" that mocks former US President Donald Trump's false claim about immigrants eating pets in Springfield, Ohio. The video has gone viral and features edited audio of Trump with auto-tuned animal sounds. Proceeds from streaming will benefit the Clark County SPCA.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: AI chatbot that persuades users to stop believing unfounded conspiracy theories
Brazil SC judge seizes $3 million from Elon Musk’s X and Starlink in fines dispute
item.description: Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes has seized nearly $3 million from the bank accounts of social media platform X and satellite internet provider Starlink, both owned by Elon Musk, to collect unpaid fines. This move has raised legal questions about holding Starlink accountable for X's penalties since they are separate entities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Houston shocker: Cats cut in half found in East End amid speculative pet-eating theories in Ohio
item.description: Houston is dealing with a chilling case of animal cruelty as several severed cat bodies have been found in public areas over the past two weeks. The Houston Police Department's Animal Cruelty Unit is investigating these incidents urgently. Additionally, around 50 dead animals were discovered on a property in San Leon, Texas, leading to criminal charges against the owner.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump, at 18, takes the lead as ‘DeFi Visionary’ in new Trump family crypto platform World Liberty Financial
item.description: Donald Trump is introducing World Liberty Financial, a cryptocurrency platform overseen by his sons and led by Barron Trump as the DeFi visionary. This venture seeks to transform financial services through blockchain technology. The official announcement is scheduled for September 16 at Mar-a-Lago.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pope Francis on US election: 'Both Trump and Harris are against life, choose the lesser of two evils'
item.description: Pope Francis criticized US presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris for their stances on immigration and abortion. Speaking aboard his plane returning to Rome, he labeled both as 'against life' and urged voters to consider the moral implications of their choices. He emphasized the need for voters to choose the lesser of two evils.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump vows 'large deportations' in US amid false claims of Haitians eating pets in Ohio: 'We will start in Springfield'
item.description: Donald Trump has promised mass deportations from Springfield, Ohio, if re-elected, alleging without evidence that Haitian migrants are consuming pets. Local officials and experts dispute these claims and highlight the migrants' positive impact. Governor Mike DeWine announced a $2.5 million initiative to improve healthcare services strained by the migrant population.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Imran Khan blames military for CM disappearance, says Pakistan scene is ‘Yahya Khan Part II’
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Sunita Williams addresses bone density loss concerns, shares her workout routine in space
item.description: Suni said if they do not work out every day, they will lose bone density. Sunita Williams wakes up at 6.30 am while Butch is an early-riser and wakes up at 4.30am. Their exercise regime includes cardio vascular, running on the treadmill, using a machine to perform deadlifts and squats etc.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump reveals what Laura Loomer is to his campaign: "I don't control her'
item.description: Donald Trump addressed the controversy over Laura Loomer's racist remarks about Kamala Harris, describing Loomer as a 'free spirit.' He emphasized that he does not control her actions and said she is just a supporter. He said he was not aware of Laura Loomer's comments on Kamala Harris but will take a look. .
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore to vote for US election from Space: 'Very important duty'
item.description: Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore Friday said that they are looking forward to cast their ballot in the US election from the International Space Station as their return has been delayed. Answering a question on voting, Wilmore said he sent down his request for a ballot today as it is a very important duty and Nasa makes sure that they are able to cast their votes. Sunita agreed and said she is looking forward to be able to vote from Space.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
